channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Sport - Football
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Real on top of the world after Ronaldo hat-trick
item.description: A Cristiano Ronaldo hat-trick helped Real Madrid to avoid a major upset against Kashima Antlers to win the Club World Cup final 4-2 after extra time in Yokohoma Sunday.

item.title: Costa heads Chelsea to 11th straight win
item.description: Chelsea's impressive winning run continued in the English Premier League Saturday as a 1-0 victory at Crystal Palace made it 11 straight to stretch its lead at the top of the standings to nine points.

item.title: Klopp's next generation of stars told: 'Be humble'
item.description: Liverpool's current generation of footballers might be inspiring dreams of a first league title since 1990 -- but the club's hopes for future domination are being built in a manner that belies the money-driven, "spend big" nature of the English Premier League.

item.title: Neymar reveals secret to MSN success
item.description: He's one third of the world's most deadly strike force -- but it's not all about flicks, tricks and goals for Neymar and his partners in crime.

item.title: Whose skills would you choose?
item.description: Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo? Everybody has their favorite player, but could choose skills from more than one and create an unbeatable superstar?

item.title: Neymar creates his perfect player
item.description: CNN asked Barcelona star Neymar which former and current world stars he would combine to create his "ultimate football player."

item.title: Chape to play first game since plane crash
item.description: The Brazilian football team which lost most of its squad in a plane crash in Colombia last month will return to action for the first time at the end of January, club officials have confirmed to CNN.

item.title: $82M 'misfit' proves his value
item.description: Once one of the most feared strikers in the Premier League, Christian Benteke is now rebuilding his reputation -- and market value -- at one of the English top flight's less glamorous teams.

item.title: Clubs oppose World Cup expansion
item.description: First Germany coach Joachim Low. Then Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola. Now the organization that speaks for Europe's biggest football clubs has rejected FIFA's plan to expand the World Cup in 2026.

item.title: Is Pogba worth $120 million?
item.description: As history's most expensive footballer, Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba has been the subject of intense scrutiny since returning to English football.

item.title: When football met eSports
item.description: Bora "Yellowstar" Kim, head of eSports at Paris Saint Germain, tells CNN of the collaboration between football and eSports.

item.title: Qatar's new laws 'don't stop exploitation'
item.description: Amnesty International claims Qatar's new laws do not improve the rights of migrant workers, who are key to the building of 12 stadiums for the 2022 World Cup.

item.title: Messi meets Afghan 'plastic bag' boy
item.description: An Afghan boy who gained online fame after a picture of him wearing a makeshift Lionel Messi jersey went viral has finally met his football hero in Doha, Qatar.

item.title: Is THIS the best league in the world?
item.description: From pioneering technology to the biggest crowds in Europe, the Bundesliga could stake a claim to being the world's best.

item.title: Ronaldo beats Messi to best player award
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo secured his fourth Ballon d'Or title Monday, beating old rival Lionel Messi to be voted the world's best footballer over the previous 12 months.

item.title: Barcelona to face PSG in last 16
item.description: Barcelona will face Paris Saint-Germain while Bayern Munich will meet Arsenal in the last 16 of the Champions League.

item.title: The meteoric rise of 'Baby Mourinho'
item.description: Imagine taking charge of a major company in a high-pressure, big-money industry, before you've even turned 30.

item.title: Alonso: Soccer's serial winner
item.description: Xabi Alonso has played for some of Europe's top clubs: Liverpool, Real Madrid and now Bayern Munich. He is full of praise for the German Bundesliga.

item.title: Robben reveals Bayern's locker room secrets
item.description: From a small Dutch town to the very top of European football, Arjen Robben has been there, done it and got the trophies.

item.title: CNN anchor's open letter to club
item.description: To our friends at Chapecoense,
